chapters.title: Why Debate Matters
chapters.subtitle: The case for structured disagreement
chapters.description: Discover why debate is the most undervalued skill in modern life and how the Greeks invented the technology for productive disagreement.

chapters.title: The Greek Legacy
chapters.subtitle: Where rhetoric was born
chapters.description: Explore the origins of rhetoric in ancient Greece and how it became the foundation of Western education.

chapters.title: The Rhetorical Triangle
chapters.subtitle: Ethos, pathos, logos—the three pillars
chapters.description: Learn Aristotle's framework for understanding persuasion through the three appeals: character, emotion, and logic.

chapters.title: Kairos
chapters.subtitle: The art of perfect timing
chapters.description: Master the Greek concept of kairos—the opportune moment for speech and action.

chapters.title: Ethos: Building Credibility
chapters.subtitle: Why trust matters more than truth
chapters.description: Understand how credibility works and why audiences trust some speakers more than others.

chapters.title: Character in Action
chapters.subtitle: Demonstrating virtue through argument
chapters.description: Learn to demonstrate character through your arguments rather than merely claiming it.

chapters.title: Pathos: Moving Hearts
chapters.subtitle: The ethical use of emotion
chapters.description: Discover how to use emotional appeals ethically and effectively in persuasion.

chapters.title: The Emotions Catalog
chapters.subtitle: Aristotle's map of human feeling
chapters.description: Explore Aristotle's systematic analysis of human emotions and their role in persuasion.

chapters.title: Logos: Constructing Reason
chapters.subtitle: The architecture of logical argument
chapters.description: Build arguments with solid logical structure using enthymemes and syllogisms.

chapters.title: Evidence and Proof
chapters.subtitle: What counts as support
chapters.description: Learn what counts as evidence and how to use different types of proof effectively.

chapters.title: Building Your Case
chapters.subtitle: Structure, claims, and warrants
chapters.description: Master the Toulmin model and other frameworks for constructing compelling arguments.

chapters.title: The Art of Refutation
chapters.subtitle: Dismantling arguments with precision
chapters.description: Learn to identify weaknesses in opposing arguments and refute them systematically.

chapters.title: Fallacies and Traps
chapters.subtitle: Recognizing bad arguments
chapters.description: Identify and avoid logical fallacies that undermine arguments.

chapters.title: The Socratic Method
chapters.subtitle: Questions as weapons and tools
chapters.description: Master the art of strategic questioning to expose assumptions and guide discovery.

chapters.title: Steelmanning
chapters.subtitle: Strengthening your opponent's case
chapters.description: Learn the art of presenting the strongest version of opposing arguments.

chapters.title: Debate in the Workplace
chapters.subtitle: Persuasion in professional settings
chapters.description: Apply rhetorical skills in meetings, presentations, and professional disagreements.

chapters.title: Debate in Education
chapters.subtitle: Teaching and learning through argument
chapters.description: Use debate as a tool for deeper learning and critical thinking.

chapters.title: Digital Discourse
chapters.subtitle: Rhetoric in the age of social media
chapters.description: Navigate online arguments and apply classical rhetoric to digital communication.

chapters.title: Debate as Civic Duty
chapters.subtitle: Democracy and the public forum
chapters.description: Understand debate's role in democratic citizenship and public discourse.

chapters.title: The Philosopher's Victory
chapters.subtitle: Winning by seeking truth
chapters.description: Discover what winning really means and how the Greeks understood true victory.

appendix.title: Competing on SuperDebate
appendix.subtitle: Classical rhetoric meets competitive online debate
appendix.description: A focused guide for applying classical rhetoric to competitive online debate. Master time-pressure tactics, written debate rhetoric, and platform-specific strategies.
